title: Bessent Stakes Credibility and Taxpayer Money on Argentina Bet
summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s multibillion-dollar bailout of a serial defaulter raises the specter of losses for the United States.

title: Putin Plays to Trump’s Ego as U.S. Wavers on Ukraine Aid
summary: After Thursday’s phone call with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, President Trump appeared to express doubts about supplying Ukraine with more powerful weapons.

title: Meet the Designer Who Got Zelensky Into a Suit
summary: Viktor Anisimov, one of Ukraine’s top fashion designers, first met Volodymyr Zelensky about 20 years ago, when the future president was a comedian. He didn’t want to wear a suit then either.

title: What Are Tomahawk Missiles, and Why Might Trump Give Them to Ukraine?
summary: Ukraine could receive a newly developed land-based launcher to strike Moscow and beyond.

title: U.S. Detains 2 Survivors of Latest Military Strike in Caribbean
summary: The capture of prisoners presents a major new set of legal and policy problems for the Trump administration in its escalating campaign.

title: Senators Move to Force Vote to Bar Ground Strikes in Venezuela
summary: The bid comes after the Senate rejected a similar measure to curb President Trump’s attacks against alleged drug runners in the Caribbean Sea.

title: John Bolton Pleads Not Guilty to Charges of Mishandling Classified Documents
summary: Mr. Bolton appeared in federal court in Greenbelt, Md., a day after he was indicted by a grand jury.

title: The Government Is Shut Down. But Not for Fossil Fuels.
summary: Federal workers who issue permits for oil, gas and mining operations are on the job, along with those working to repeal pollution limits.

title: Unions Return to Court as Trump Eyes Additional Cuts During Shutdown
summary: Unions representing federal workers told a judge they believed the administration might violate a temporary ban on layoffs during the shutdown.

title: U.S. Pressures Countries to Delay Fees to Clean Up Ship Pollution
summary: Under threats of tariffs and other sanctions from the U.S., nations postponed a vote on whether to charge fees on emissions from ships.

title: Diane Keaton’s Legacy as a House Renovator and Flipper
summary: Known for her roles in film, the actress built a second act off-screen, turning the homes she renovated into another stage.

title: 7 Takeaways From the First N.Y.C. Mayoral Debate
summary: Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa sparred over serious topics like the Israel-Hamas war and President Trump, and more curious subjects like parade attendance.

title: Cuomo Ramps Up Attacks on Sliwa as He Hunts for Republican Votes
summary: The morning after the first mayoral debate of the general election, Andrew M. Cuomo said it would be nearly impossible to win if Curtis Sliwa did not drop out. Mr. Sliwa said he was not going anywhere.

title: For Mamdani and Cuomo, It Was Tie vs. Tie in the New York Mayoral Debate
summary: The small details connected Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa’s presentation to their policies.

title: Some Chicago Businesses Feeling the Impact of Trump’s Immigration Blitz
summary: More customers and workers are staying home, they say, leading to lower revenue and worries of wider economic repercussions for the city.

title: Trump Was Not the Only President Who Tried to Force Migrants to Leave
summary: For decades, the United States tried to push undocumented people to self-deport, but success has often depended on coercion.

title: After ‘Horrors,’ Israeli Hostages Taste Freedom and Savor Family Reunions
summary: Some former captives have been sent home from the hospital. But a doctor said they all had “endured untold adversity,” as details emerge of their time in Gaza’s tunnels.

title: What’s Next for the Gaza Cease-Fire Plan
summary: Israel and Hamas have reached a cease-fire deal in Gaza, but the hard part starts now. David Sanger of The New York Times describes the major obstacles to further agreement about Gaza’s immediate future.

title: U.S. Says Louisiana Man Joined Hamas-Led 2023 Attack on Israel
summary: A man was in custody after federal prosecutors accused him of joining Gazan militants in attacking Israel on Oct. 7, 2023. He was also accused of lying to obtain a U.S. visa.

title: At a Fading ‘Island of Misfit Toys,’ Zoo Animals Face a Grim Fate
summary: It went from one of the worst zoos in America to a beloved menagerie filled with disabled and elderly native species. Now the money has just about run out.

title: How a Long Island Woman Was Diagnosed With Chikungunya
summary: A Long Island woman had no idea what had hit her. Her pursuit of an answer led to a mosquito-borne disease rarely seen in the United States.

title: Investors Shudder at Signs of Loan Trouble in Banks
summary: After months of roaring share prices, stock investors were rattled this week by reports of souring debts on bank balance sheets.

title: For 3 Years, the Bull Market Defied Inflation, Tariffs and Gravity
summary: Born during the Biden administration, the market’s bull run almost ended in April, but stocks got a second wind with the artificial intelligence boom.

title: For $900, This Subway Seat Could Be Yours
summary: The annual pop-up sale of retired signs and other transit artifacts from the New York City subway system attracted a line of collectors that stretched for blocks.

title: Russia Won’t Stop Until NATO Acts
summary: The only way to contain Putin is with a resolute show of strength.

title: How Baby Boomers Blew Up the American Dream
summary: The postwar generation had a good run. Now we’re all paying for it.

title: Baek Sehee, South Korean Author of ‘I Want to Die, but I Want to Eat Tteokbokki,’ Dies at 35
summary: She turned recorded sessions with her therapist into a best-selling memoir, helping to normalize conversations around mental health in South Korea.

title: Devastating Floods in Mexico Test President Claudia Sheinbaum
summary: Torrential rains last week brought death and widespread damage. President Claudia Sheinbaum has visited affected areas, facing some angry residents.

title: China Ousts Senior General on Corruption Charges
summary: With the fall of He Weidong, the No. 3 figure in China’s military hierarchy, Xi Jinping’s purges have reached the top of the People’s Liberation Army.
